page.title: 06Farming Today
page.content: Years ago farmers could make a living on 100 acres. Now they can't even make a living on 700 acres because they are putting the wrong crops on wrong land. Machinery has changed dramatically. Horses used to pull one furrow plough. Now tractors can rule a farm which means that the tractor is the most important piece of machinery and can be used to plough with as many ploughs as the tractor will allow. It can power harrow. This is when the implement on the back breaks the soil and it makes a better job than any other implement. We are cereal and root crop farmers. I think farming is going to change in the future to computers. All you will have to do is press a button and a 90 acre field will be ploughed. Or robots will come into use operating all the machinery.
